refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: eol-apt-get is like the Debian apt-get command, but it only accesses the EOL Debian repository at ftp.eol.ucar.edu, rather than the much larger Debian repositories. Therefore eol-apt-get is usually a faster way to update our local packages. eol-apt-get update updates the system list of available packages, which will then only include the EOL packages. This becomes a problem if you then need to install or update a package from the Debian repositories, because apt-get won't be able to find it. In that case, you must do sudo apt-get update to get the complete list of packages again. The warning message: The following packages have been kept back is an indication that a local package wasn't updated because a package that it needs is not available. sudo apt-get update should fix the problem.
eolupdate is shorthand for sudo eol-apt-get update && sudo eol-apt-get -y upgrade
allupdate is shorthand for sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get -y dist-upgrade
